column1: This #SmallBizSaturday shop small and shop safe. Here are some tips so you can support local businesses while protecting your health ⬇️ https://t.co/b5qMBSsXOX

.@RepSusieLee I am heartbroken to hear of your mother’s passing. Paul and I send our deepest condolences to you and your family during this difficult time and we wish you a swift recovery. https://t.co/gMRA6OwpsU

This Thanksgiving I’m grateful for our 1st responders & health care workers who are on the frontlines of the #COVID pandemic. I’m thankful for the spirit of giving in the Silver State & every Nevadan doing their part to combat this pandemic.  Thank you & happy Thanksgiving. https://t.co/dLG6DGCLye

I’m also thankful this Thanksgiving to serve the people of Nevada and our great state in Congress. Nevadans know that I‘m fighting to get our communities the federal support resources & funding we need to keep Nevadans healthy weather this pandemic & continue safely reopening.

Due to #COVID this Thanksgiving looks different than last year’s. As we each do our part to combat #COVID in Nevada I want Nevadans to know that their sacrifices are seen and appreciated. We are in this together and I am so proud of our state—home truly means Nevada. https://t.co/YwHwqjIO9h
Saddened to hear of Brent Boynton’s passing. Over the years he worked hard to make a difference in his community. He‘ll be dearly missed. https://t.co/TgnfAlnuEi

As Thanksgiving approaches I’m grateful that Nevadans have groups like @threesquareLV to lend a helping hand. I’ll keep fighting in the Senate to ensure these hardworking organizations and all Nevadans have the support and resources they need to weather this pandemic.

Thank you to the entire @threesquareLV team for all the incredible work you do. It was great visiting a Three Square mobile site today to volunteer and hear directly from Nevadans who are experiencing food insecurity. https://t.co/l2jy0wFrRg

With #COVID cases rising in Nevada @SNHDinfo has some tips on how to have a safe Thanksgiving:   ◼ celebrate Thanksgiving with just your household ◼ avoid traveling ◼ #WearAMask   For more info read here ⬇️ https://t.co/2hw3FmqvcA

This past Veterans Day @smithsonian debuted the National Native American Veterans Memorial to honor the generations of service of Native American men & women.   @rgj spoke to Native American vets & NV tribal members about what this memorial means to them. https://t.co/SfWzf9gbtY

It’s long overdue for Congress to create a @Smithsonian museum that would amplify the voices of women & showcase the many stories of women’s resilience advocacy & courage. The Smithsonian American Women’s History Museum Act would do just that. Read more⬇️https://t.co/InzEiaCPHH
Stay alert and safe this winter by taking the necessary steps to protect your home from fires. Read more about what precautions you can take ⬇️ https://t.co/LABrUIqgFi

ICYMI: Are you and your family enrolled in a health care plan? If not watch our #BattleBornUpdate to hear from @SenJackyRosen and me about how you can #GetCovered during open enrollment.  WATCH ⬇ https://t.co/vblLhPiCdz

A full understanding of women’s history & Latino history is important for all of us. I’ll keep pushing to pass the legislation that will create a women’s history museum & natl. Latino museum to make sure the next generation has a place to learn & celebrate this heritage. https://t.co/uYxCVk4HYB

A furry friend can bring joy and be great company during the pandemic. “Senior for Seniors” is a pet adoption program that lets Nevadans over 65 adopt senior cats or dogs for free. Read more ⬇️ https://t.co/BsBiNksDqe

During yesterday’s Senate Rules Cmte hearing I discussed the importance of creating a Smithsonian American Women’s History Museum & the Natl. Museum of the American Latino. Read about how these museums will benefit Americans from every background ➡️ https://t.co/C9BsN5hOoN
It’s past time for women’s and Latinos’ stories to be told. The House voted on bills that will create museums to do just that. Now the Senate must pass important companion legislation.

When mis- and disinformation spread Nevadans should turn to official sources for facts about their ballots and know how to identify scam calls & misinformation. Read this thread from @ClarkCountyNV for an important update ⬇ https://t.co/nTGsQ2wTCT

Anti-transgender violence has no place in this nation. On #TransDayofRemembrance we remember transgender people who have lost their lives in hateful acts of violence. I stand in solidarity with the transgender community & will keep working to end the violence & bigotry they face

GSA Admin Emily Murphy needs to immediately recognize VP Biden as Pres-elect & Sen Kamala Harris as VP-elect. Her delay in acknowledging VP Biden as Pres-elect could undermine efforts to meet the needs of the American people in the middle of a pandemic. https://t.co/7FFV8Nbkyz

My Accessible Affordable Internet for All Act & ACCESS BROADBAND Act would provide more funding opportunities to address the significant broadband gaps across the US & expand connectivity for underserved rural & urban communities #InnovationState  https://t.co/25F92mqFEy

Bridging the digital divide for students in Nevada and across the nation has been a priority of mine since I was elected. With the coronavirus creating the need for virtual classrooms Congress must prioritize bills that invest in broadband now not later. https://t.co/SyLyQfu8kq

It's key that the US leads the setting of international standards for emerging tech—like 5G & AI—and that the process remains democratic & transparent. I'm introducing a bipartisan bill to help ensure China isn’t exerting undue influence on the process ➡ https://t.co/GEAYbwmc6v

A special thank you to the @NellisAFB Airmen who worked with the Washington County Sheriff’s Office in Utah to successfully execute a rescue mission to save six people. You all are heroes! https://t.co/fGO9aghpmD

This November marks National Native American Heritage Month a time to honor the cultural diversity and history of Native people and the ways they have influenced America. I am glad to see the Senate today pass a resolution recognizing this important month https://t.co/lVDQZY0meZ

The travel and tourism industry has been hard hit by the #COVID pandemic and desperately needs support. I'm joining colleagues in calling on the DHS to increase the safety of air travel & support the recovery of our nation’s travel and tourism industry. https://t.co/xjC7LbAwRV

I'm proud to be leading a group of bipartisan Senators in ensuring the Navy does right by 515 Navy officers who lost pay and benefits they were owed as a result of their participation in the STA-21 program including 2 of ours in Nevada. https://t.co/aWIHnRQDN4

This National Military Family Month we thank and show our appreciation for our military families who each day share in the sacrifices of their loved ones bravely serving our country. To our military families thank you for all that you do!

#TPS recipients are facing the pandemic while also fearing the need to leave the US—and more than 130000 TPS holders are essential workers. I'm leading my colleagues in urging the Senate to protect TPS holders. https://t.co/7DmdVaSNtJ

Survivors should not have to bear the burden of out-of-pocket costs such as mental health counseling lost wages and other expenses due to delays outside of their control. This bill will ensure survivors of sexual assault have fair access to benefits for crime victims.

While states across the country have made great strides in testing hundreds of thousands of rape kits in recent years it’s unacceptable that delays in testing have prevented some survivors of sexual assault from benefiting from state victim compensation programs.

Justice delayed should not result in assistance denied. I am proud to introduce a new bipartisan bill that will ensure that sexual assault survivors remain eligible to apply for compensation after state program deadlines have passed ➡️  https://t.co/VkpieQaqt8

If you’re a #Medicare beneficiary now is the time to compare your coverage options by visiting https://t.co/Yl6e9zmoKr to browse plans. @DhhsNevada also offers free and personalized counseling to NV’s #Medicare beneficiaries. For more info visit ➡️ https://t.co/c3QHaEirYl

Judy Shelton Trump's nominee to the Fed Reserve has views that are so dangerous that there's bipartisan support to reject her confirmation. Confirming Shelton would be a vote against a stable economy that supports workers& their families.   That's why I'm voting to #StopShelton

Nevadans don’t want nuclear waste in their backyards. That’s why @SenJackyRosen & I continue to speak out against any Yucca Mountain funding. I’m glad our demands were heard & the Senate Approps Cmte is recommending zero funds for this misguided project. https://t.co/N6a41IJxAz

30 years ago today Red Rock Canyon was designated as Nevada's first National Conservation Area. This special landscape offers countless outdoor rec opportunities & breathtaking views. It's a treasure in our state & an important reminder of why we must protect our public lands.

Congratulations to @NevadaFootball's very own Carson Strong and Lawson Hall for being recognized nationally w/ honors from the College Football Performance Awards and Wuerffel Trophy. Way to represent the #WolfPack & the state. https://t.co/DFazCgq8Mk
Wishing you a swift recovery @GovSisolak! https://t.co/a4LLueeZob

For veterans in Nevada spending time in our state's magnificent outdoor spaces can be therapeutic. This bill will help veterans who have experienced trauma heal & benefit from our incredible public lands here in Nevada & across the country. #VetsOutdoors https://t.co/c4ixPkuwdd

Excited the Senate passed my bill the Accelerating Veterans Recovery Outdoors Act! This bill's passage is great news for vets who often turn to outdoor rec as a way to take care of their mental & physical health. I look forward to this bill being signed into law. #VetsOutdoors
From now until January 15th you can sign up for health care and see if you qualify for subsidies by visiting https://t.co/2kPIHMXNNL. Don’t wait until it’s too late!
Wishing those who are celebrating in Nevada and across the nation a happy and reflective #Diwali.
Estamos viendo un aumento en casos de #COVID19 en todo nuestro estado y país. Descarga la aplicación COVID Trace y ayuda a detener la propagación del coronavirus en Nevada. https://t.co/lRafFomJic
We’re seeing surging #COVID19 cases across our state and country. Download @NVHealthRespon1's COVID Trace app today and help stop the spread of the coronavirus in Nevada. https://t.co/Thc3BFWRPY

.@NVEmergencyMgmt is receiving $1.6M in @fema grant funding for our state's #COVID19 response efforts. I'm glad to see this funding and I’ll keep working in the Senate to get the support we need to make sure Nevada slows the spread of the virus. https://t.co/S05VurPrcn
Los casos de #COVID están subiendo en Nevada. Usa una máscarilla y proteje a tu comunidad. https://t.co/w3PrmAQnO1

Fresh water is one of the most important& scarce resources on the planet. I’m so grateful to see the Walker River Irrigation District receive funding through the WaterSMART Initiative program to help NV’s farmers& ranchers better conserve our water supply https://t.co/Z74XYl5l1I
It’s #OpenEnrollment season! That means you can protect your family by enrolling in to a health care plan on @NVHealthLink’s website.  To #GetCovered today visit ➡️https://t.co/MnpRtTwNMT

We owe each and every veteran a debt of gratitude. And though we can never fully repay that debt we must ensure veterans and their families have every resource they have earned and deserve.  To Nevada’s veterans and veterans all across the nation: thank you. https://t.co/Vkb7zCkuYb

This #Alzheimers Disease Awareness Month I’m thinking of those who've been affected by this devastating disease including my own family. Let’s continue to come together to support all who are struggling with Alzheimer’s and other dementias in our communities. #ENDALZ

Today we honor our veterans who’ve served our country & defended our freedom. As we reflect on and remember their service let’s recommit ourselves to ensuring they have the support they need in combat and when they return home. #VeteransDay https://t.co/whebc22m0D

#SCOTUS heard oral arguments in California v Texas today. Remember #WhatsAtStake if Trump's lawsuit succeeds: 20M people could lose health coverage & 135M people could lose pre-existing conditions protections.  We need to protect health care not rip it away—esp during a pandemic
#SemperFi! Today we celebrate 245 years of @USMC. Thank you to each and every U.S. Marine and Marine veteran who has served our nation and defended our freedoms.
#COVID cases are rising in Nevada. Wear a mask and protect your community. https://t.co/wiuiba7efk
Una de las maneras más fáciles y mejores de protegerte a tí mismo a tu familia y a tu comunidad es usando una máscarilla. ¡Así que #UsaUnaMascarilla!

Democracy can be slow sometimes but it’s worth it. Thank you to all the poll workers election officials and so many more across the country who worked around the clock—in the middle of a pandemic—to make sure every American could vote and have their ballot counted. https://t.co/70qk7Uaiap

Thanks @RepHorsford!  I #MaskUp for every community in NV that has been impacted by this pandemic& encourage folks across the state to mask up for our frontline workers& our vulnerable populations. #NevadaStrong  Over to @GovSisolak @NevadaAG @SenKamalaHarris& @SenatorCantwell https://t.co/PtrzOTGYKx https://t.co/ERsF0PtSrF

One of the easiest and best ways you can protect yourself your family and your community is by wearing a mask. So #WearAMask!

Congratulations to President-elect @JoeBiden and Vice President-elect @SenKamalaHarris. Their message tonight is one of unity—and their vision is one of a stronger more united America. I look forward to working with them for the people of Nevada and this nation.

There is no reason to rush this nominee. There is every reason to act on a comprehensive #COVID19 relief package. It’s what we should’ve been doing months ago. We’ve seen over 225000 Americans die—and yet the Majority Leader pushes forward to pack the Court.

#WhatsAtStake if Trump & McConnell get their way & the ACA is dismantled? Over 20M Americans wld lose their health coverage & >135M people wld lose protections for their preexisting conditions—including 95K Nevadans who’ve had #COVID & 1.2M Nevadans w/other preexisting conditions

On November 10 #SCOTUS will hear arguments in a court case about whether the ACA is constitutional. Senator McConnell & President Trump want a justice who shares their views on the ACA seated on the Court by that date.

For 7 months Sen. McConnell has blocked #COVID relief legislation. It only took him a few weeks to push thru a #SCOTUS nom who will be the deciding vote in a case that cld end the ACA.  It’s clear what Sen. McConnell’s priorities are & helping the American people isn’t 1 of them

On this #Juneteenth I honor the rich achievements of Black Nevadans in building a better future and I promise to continue to work side by side with communities of color in the Silver State to make sure that every Nevadan can thrive.

But celebration can be a revolutionary act. The women and men who celebrated the first Juneteenth in the heat of a Texas summer knew that the future held countless obstacles—yet they also held out hope for the future.

This year as we mark #Juneteenth we are reminded that the promise of freedom and liberation for African-Americans remains elusive and that our focus must continue to be on what Martin Luther King Jr. called ‘the fierce urgency of now’ in making meaningful change.
